definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to rule a country according to the constitution

sentences.english: The article content is divided into three parts:Part one, the rise of the constitutionalism group at the beginning of the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分，20世紀初立憲派的興起。

sentences.english: Roman republic is a pioneer of the modern constitutionalism.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬共和國是近代立憲主義的先驅。

sentences.english: Wang Lixian recalled the circumstances at that time, feeling a bit agitated.
sentences.chinese: 王立憲回憶起當時的情景，情緒有些激動。

sentences.english: This kind of constitutionalism is analyzed to be completely different from orthodox public finance and tax revenue theory.
sentences.chinese: 這種立憲分析與正統的公共財政和稅收理論完全不同。

sentences.english: Financial constitutionalism is the important part of modern national constitutionalism construction.
sentences.chinese: 財政立憲是現代國家憲政建設的重要內容。

sentences.english: As constitutionalists correctly argue, democracies can be managed and manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 正如立憲者所說，可以管理和操縱民主。

sentences.english: Overall evaluate Yang Du's constitutional monarchy idea.
sentences.chinese: 對楊度的君主立憲思想進行總體評價。

sentences.english: Clarify detailed content and characteristics of Yang Du's constitutional monarchy idea.
sentences.chinese: 闡述楊度的君主立憲思想的具體內容及特點。

sentences.english: Wang Lixian recalled the scene at the time and became a little emotional.
sentences.chinese: 王立憲回憶起當時的情景，情緒有些激動。

sentences.english: Norway is a constitutional monarchy with a parliamentary system of government.
sentences.chinese: 挪威是一個議會體系的政府立憲制國家。

sentences.english: Cambodia is now a constitutional monarchy where executive power is held by the prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 柬埔寨現在是一個君主立憲制國家，首相行使行政權。

sentences.english: These students became the Constitutional Group among the students studying in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 這部分人成爲留日學生中的立憲派。

sentences.english: The preparation for constitutionalism in the bite Qing dynasty was the outcome of the political compromise, which rarely existed in the political history of China.
sentences.chinese: 晚清預備立憲是中國政治史上鮮有的政治妥協的產物。

sentences.english: Constitutional monarchy began after the Glorious Revolution in 1688.
sentences.chinese: 君主立憲制是從1688年的光榮革命後開始。

sentences.english: Burke's theory of rights is a theory in defense of British Constitutional Monarchy .
sentences.chinese: 柏克的權利理論是爲英國君主立憲政體辯護的理論。

sentences.english: It is a kingdom which does not have a constitutional monarch.
sentences.chinese: 英國是一個沒有立憲君主的王國。

definition: principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
